availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas C. Dabney (Trigg County, Kentucky, attorney and judge)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, attorney and judge. King William County, Virginia, native. Married to Susanna Rumsey Dabney in Christian County, Kentucky, on March 6, 1848. Father of James Rumsey Dabney, Albert J. Dabney, Carmelia Dabney, Thomas C. Dabney Jr., Annie Dabney, Minnie Dabney, Frank Dabney, Smith Dabney, and Carrie L. Dabney. Attorney in Trigg County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850. Special judge in Henderson County from December 7, 1857, to December 31, 1859. Circuit court judge in the 2nd Judicial District in Trigg County from 1859 to 1862. Owned one enslaved person, employed by G. A. Wright, in Trigg County in 1860. Resident in Cadiz in 1863.
